meanings.definition: A time of intense difficulty, trouble, or danger.
meanings.sent1: During the crisis, everyone worked together to find a solution.
meanings.sent2: The country faced a financial crisis after the stock market crashed.
meanings.sent3: When the cake fell on the floor, it was a baking crisis!
meanings.sent4: Her sudden illness was a crisis that brought the family closer together.
meanings.sent5: The storm created a crisis as people scrambled to find shelter.

meanings.definition: A turning point in the course of anything; decisive or crucial time, stage, or event.
meanings.sent1: The meeting was a crisis where decisions had to be made.
meanings.sent2: His promotion marked a crisis in his career, leading to new opportunities.
meanings.sent3: For the caterpillar, becoming a butterfly is a metamorphic crisis!
meanings.sent4: The sunrise symbolized a crisis, signaling the start of a new day.
meanings.sent5: The discovery of the cure was a crisis in the fight against the disease.

meanings.definition: A sudden, urgent, usually unexpected occurrence or event.
meanings.sent1: The fire alarm signaled a crisis in the building.
meanings.sent2: The car breakdown on the highway created a crisis for the travelers.
meanings.sent3: Running out of popcorn during the movie night was a snack crisis!
meanings.sent4: The power outage was a crisis that left everyone in the dark.
meanings.sent5: The sudden rainstorm caused a crisis for the outdoor event.
